neighbors.name: Trevor G Gilkey
neighbors.claims: Trevor G. Gilkey is a prominent row-crop farmer in Caldwell County, having received about $1.58 million in federal farm commodity subsidies from 1995 through 2024 [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=21033&progcode=totalfarm&regionname=CaldwellCounty,Kentucky). He does not hold any known public office or board position locally, as his name is absent from county agricultural or civic leadership listings [Kentucky Farm Bureau – Caldwell County](https://www.kyfb.com/caldwell/about-us/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local agriculture figure or extension agent approach him directly, emphasizing how the project can coexist with farming and respect his family’s land legacy.

neighbors.name: Misty Browning
neighbors.claims: Misty Browning is a private landowner in Caldwell County with no evident public or civic roles; her name does not appear in county official directories or on local boards [Caldwell County Directory](https://caldwellcounty.ky.gov/phone-directory/Pages/default.aspx). A search of local news and records found no references to her involvement in community or development issues as of 2026 [Kentucky Farm Bureau – Caldwell County](https://www.kyfb.com/caldwell/about-us/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out with a personal, neighborly visit by a project representative to hear her concerns one-on-one and address any questions, given her low public profile.

overview_summary: None of the profiled neighbors have made a documented public stance on the proposed development, with both categorized as "unknown" in their views. One neighbor is a prominent large-scale farmer in the community, indicating moderate local influence, while the other has a minimal public profile or influence.
